item.title: Implementing a redis cache in dotnet
item.description: I recently had to implement a cache in an application to avoid unnecessary database queries, and that was cool. I’ve worked with Redis in the past, but I think I’ve done it the wrong way because implementing a cache with Redis has never been so cool. Redis vs Mem cached Redis is almost like a NoSql database, but it is even better because it stores data with key and value and with that, it is much easier to use it as a cache.
